remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for coming in today. I understand you experienced a significant fall down several steps with multiple injuries. Can you describe any current symptoms you are experiencing, such as pain, difficulty moving, or changes in how you feel since the fall?

remedi_labels.value: acknowledges patient experienced a significant fall with multiple injuries
changes in how you feel since the fall

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… I fell down about 27 steps and, uh, I have a lot of pain, mostly in my hip and leg. That’s the main thing right now. I’m just worried because it really pains.

I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious—falling down so many steps and now having significant pain in your hip and leg must be very distressing. To help guide my assessment, can you tell me if you’ve noticed any swelling, bruising, or difficulty moving your hip or leg since the fall?

Um… yeah, there’s definitely some swelling and bruising around my hip. It’s hard to move my leg, too. I didn’t lose consciousness or anything, but I’m just really concerned about the pain and not being able to move like I usually can.

I can understand why you’d be worried—experiencing severe pain, swelling, and difficulty moving your hip after such a significant fall is understandably concerning. To help guide my assessment, can you tell me if you’ve noticed any numbness, tingling, or weakness in your leg since the injury?

Let me think… I don’t really feel numbness, but maybe a little tingling once in a while. My leg does feel kind of weak, though, especially when I try to move it. And, um, I’ve been feeling pretty agitated since it happened. I just can’t seem to settle down. Should I be worried about that?

remedi_labels.value: Should I be worried about that?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about these symptoms—experiencing pain, weakness, and agitation after such a significant fall is understandably distressing. To further guide my assessment, have you noticed any changes in your ability to control your bladder or bowels since the injury?

remedi_labels.value: changes in ability to control bladder or bowels

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um… no, I haven’t noticed any changes with my bladder or bowels since the fall. Everything seems the same there. I was a little worried about that, but so far, nothing unusual. Is that something I should watch out for?

remedi_labels.value: no changes with bladder or bowels
no unusual symptoms since the fall
should I watch out for changes with bladder or bowels

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be anxious, especially after such a significant fall and with the symptoms you’ve described. Since you mentioned pain, swelling, bruising, and some weakness in your leg, have you noticed any changes in your ability to bear weight or walk since the injury, or are you unable to stand or move the affected leg at all?

remedi_labels.value: pain, swelling, bruising, weakness in leg
changes in ability to bear weight or walk, unable to stand or move the affected leg

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… I haven’t really been able to put any weight on that leg since the fall. It pains too much, and when I try, it just feels really weak and kind of gives out. I haven’t tried to walk because I’m afraid I’ll fall again. I can move my toes a little, but moving the whole leg is really hard. Is that normal after something like this?

remedi_labels.value: unable to put weight on leg
Is that normal after something like this?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about not being able to bear weight and experiencing anxious after such a serious fall. Given your symptoms of pain, swelling, weakness, and difficulty moving your leg, have you noticed any deformity or abnormal shape in your hip or leg that might suggest a possible fracture or dislocation?

remedi_labels.value: deformity or abnormal shape in hip or leg

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Actually… now that you mention it, my hip does look kind of different—like it’s sticking out more on one side, and my leg seems a little turned in. I remember when I had that right hip dislocation a few years ago, it sort of feels similar, but maybe worse this time. Does that mean it could be dislocated again, or maybe even fractured? Should I be worried about permanent damage if it is?

remedi_labels.value: hip looks different, sticking out more on one side
leg seems a little turned in
right hip dislocation a few years ago
feels similar to previous dislocation, but worse

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be anxious, especially given your history of right hip dislocation and the current symptoms of deformity, pain, and weakness after such a significant fall. To help guide the assessment, have you experienced any symptoms such as fever, chills, or signs of infection since the injury?

Um… no, I haven’t had any fever or chills, and I don’t think there are any signs of infection—at least not that I can tell. The skin around my hip is bruised and swollen, but it’s not warm or red. I’m mostly just worried about the pain and the way my hip looks. If it is dislocated or fractured, what happens next? Will I need surgery again, or is there a way to fix it without that?

remedi_labels.value: skin around hip is bruised and swollen
skin is not warm or red
need for surgery or alternative treatment

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about the possibility of another hip dislocation or even a fracture, especially given your symptoms and medical history. To further guide my assessment, have you noticed any changes in sensation or color in your foot or toes on the affected side, such as numbness, tingling, coolness, or discoloration?

remedi_labels.value: possibility of another hip dislocation or fracture
changes in sensation or color in foot or toes (numbness, tingling, coolness, discoloration)

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Let me think… Well, I have noticed a little tingling in my toes, but I don’t think there’s any numbness. My foot feels kind of cool sometimes, but it’s not really discolored—at least, it doesn’t look blue or anything like that. Should I be worried about the tingling and coolness? Does that mean there’s a problem with the blood flow or nerves? And, um, if it is a fracture or dislocation, what’s usually the treatment? I just want to make sure I heal up okay.

remedi_labels.value: should I be worried about the tingling and coolness
does that mean there’s a problem with the blood flow or nerves
if it is a fracture or dislocation, what’s usually the treatment
